Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member Gerson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 23, June 30 and July 27, 2005 be adopted and printed by Council Member Fidler.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Fidler moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 23, June 30 and July 27, 2005 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Howard R. Vargas to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the Taxi & Limousine Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 2301 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Howad Richard Vargas, Taxi and Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Submitting the Mayor’s Management Report, Fiscal 2005, dated September 12, 2005, pursuant to Section 12 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Mayor’s Management Report, Fiscal 2005, dated September 12, 2005.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 669,  in relation to suspending the activation of parking meters on Sundays.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto Message of Int. No. 669, Suspending the activation of parking meters on Sundays.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Communication from Office of Management and Budget – transfer City funds between various agencies in fiscal year 2005 to implement changes in the City’s expense budget. (MN-8)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'05 to implement changes in the City’s expense budget. (MN-8)

Items.Title: Communication from Office of Management and Budget – transfer City funds between various agencies in fiscal year 2006 to implement changes in the City’s expense budget. (MN-2)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'06 to implement changes in the City’s expense budget. (MN-2)

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040489 ZSM, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 040488 ZMM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, York Ave. & E 61th St., Manhattan (040489ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 106-03 Metropolitan Avenue, Borough of Queens, Council District no. 29., shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20055640 TCQ.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 106-03 Metropolitan Ave., Queens (20055640TCQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Quinn:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 46 Gansevoort Street, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3., shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20055567 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, Le Gans Restaurant, Manhattan (20055567TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting employers from locking employees or other individuals inside a workplace and increasing the fines for obstruction of exits and unlawful change of exits.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting employers from locking employees or other individuals working inside a workplace.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Economic Development
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a Chinatown/Lower East Side empire zone and the repeal of section 22-715 of such code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a Chinatown/Lower East Side empire zone.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the imposition of the utility tax and providing a separate rate for such tax for certain cooperative corporations that produce and distribute electricity, steam, refrigeration or water to such cooperative corporation tenants and/or occupants.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Imposition of the utility tax.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the amendment to the Metrotech Area Business Improvement District Plan which provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law amending the District Plan for the Metrotech Area Business Improvement District.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amendment to the Metrotech Area Business Improvement District Plan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the New York Tax Law to give the City of New York the authority to replace its portion of the sales tax on motor fuel and diesel fuel with an excise tax, setting a flat/fixed cents per gallon tax rate.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend the NY Tax Law to give NYC the authority to replace its portion of the sales tax on motor fuel and diesel fuel with an excise tax, setting a flat/fixed cents per gallon tax rate.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to small businesses and the repeal of subdivision f of section 20-268 and subdivision f of section 20-296 of such code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Small businesses and the repeal of subdivision f of section 20-268 and subdivision f of section 20-296 of such code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation creating incentives for city agencies to save energy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Creating incentives for city agencies to save energy.

Items.Title: Resolution determining that Proposed Int. No. 324-A, a Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to green building standards for certain capital projects, will not have a significant adverse impact on the environment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requirements for city-owned and city-funded green buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation amending the Retirement and Social Security Law to allow members of New York City’s five pension systems on military leave and serving in Afghanistan and Iraq, and who are disabled as the natural and proximate result of an accident sustained in such service, to qualify for accidental disability benefits equal to three-quarters of their City salary.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Amend the Retirement and Social Security Law to allow members of NYC’s 5 pension systems on military leave and serving in Afghanistan and Iraq, and who are disabled to qualify for accidental disability benefits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the New York Tax Law to give the City of New York the authority to replace its portion of the sales tax on motor fuel and diesel fuel with an excise tax, setting a flat/fixed cents per gallon tax rate.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amend the NY Tax Law to give NYC the authority to replace its portion of the sales tax on motor fuel and diesel fuel with an excise tax, setting a flat/fixed cents per gallon tax rate.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clarifying the authority of the environmental control board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Clarifying the authority of the environmental control board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improving demarcations and signage at all pedestrian crosswalks and requiring demarcation of pedestrian crosswalks that connect with curb cuts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Improving demarcations and signage at all pedestrian crosswalks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the maintenance of a website containing a searchable database for small businesses owners.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Requiring the maintenance of a website containing a searchable database for small businesses owners.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the reporting and posting of the retail selling prices of gasoline and diesel motor fuels.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring the reporting and posting of the retail selling prices of gasoline and diesel motor fuels.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulating the effective period of prices posted on signs, posters or placards for the sale of gasoline and diesel motor fuel.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Regulating the effective period of prices posted on signs, posters or placards for the sale of gasoline and diesel motor fuel.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the grossly inadequate and extremely delayed response to the Hurricane Katrina crisis, and calling upon the President of the United States and the United States Congress to provide for a comprehensive, fully funded and effective national response effort, which includes the efficient coordination of aid and adequate support for the rebuilding of the area and lives of the people affected by this tragic event.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the grossly inadequate and extremely delayed response to the Hurricane Katrina crisis.

Items.Title: Resolution requesting that the Mayor of the City of New York send a budget modification to the City Council for $1 million to be appropriated to the American Red Cross to enable it to provide additional assistance in the Hurricane Katrina Relief Effort.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Requesting that the Mayor send a budget modification to the Council for $1 million to be appropriated to the American Red Cross to enable assistance in the Hurricane Katrina Relief Effort.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creation of the office of small business assistance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Creation of the office of small business assistance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to boring, strata and soil percolation testing for the on-site disposal of storm water.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Boring, strata and soil percolation testing for the on-site disposal of storm water.

Items.Title: Resolution designating the last week of each January to be known and celebrated as “Live Theatre Week” in New York City and calling upon the Mayor, the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs and the Mayor’s Office of Film, Theatre and Broadcasting to recognize and celebrate such week.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Last week of each January to be known and celebrated as “Live Theatre Week” in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the administrative adjudications board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Administrative adjudications board.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Office of Immigration and Customs Enforcement to exercise prosecutorial discretion and decline to pursue orders of removal or to carry out removal orders in exceptional situations where deportation would cause extreme hardship to individuals themselves, family or community members and further urging restoration of discretion to immigration judges to defer deportation in exceptional cases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: US Office of Immigration Customs Enforcement to exercise prosecutorial discretion.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the compensation of the public administrators.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Compensation of the public administrators.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
